questions.text: What is the point directly above your head called?
questions.explanation:
zenith.

	Zenith can also be used to describe the peak of something, such as, the zenith of his career was when he scored the winning goal.

questions.text: What is the study of animals called?
questions.explanation:
zoology.

	Much of what zoologist learn about other animals have helped the human race advance.   You can learn about grad schools for zoology all over the world by going to http://zoology.gradschools.com

questions.text: What is the name of the bird in the movie "The Lion King"?
questions.explanation:
Zazu.

	Zazu is a hornbill.  There are currently fifty-four known species of hornbills.

questions.text: "You're not fully clean unless you're ______ clean."
questions.explanation:
zestfully.

	Zest first came out in 1958. Zest is a brand of soap. The most popular zest bar is Aqua Pure which is the first bar they ever made. Other bars include: energy fresh, linen fresh, ultimate clean, spring burst, and tropical fresh.

Zimbabwe.

	Zintiana is not a country. There were only three so I had to make up a fourth. Zimbabwe's climate is mostly tropical.

True.

	Zhvaia was killed accidentally by carbon monoxide poisoning.

questions.text: Who was the Greek god of the west wind?
questions.explanation:
Zephyrus.

	Zeus is the head of the gods. Zibelthiurdos is a Thracian storm god. Zalmoxis is a god of the Getae and Dacians.

questions.text: According to Dr. Seuss what begins with Z?
questions.explanation:
Zizzer-Zazzer-Zuzz.

	"Dr. Seuss ABC" came out in 1976. Using made up words or silly phrases he goes through the entire alphabet.

questions.text: What is the name of the mayor's oldest daughter in "The Music Man"?
questions.explanation:
Zaneeta.

	Zaneeta's main saying was "Ye gods". In the original movie, Zaneeta was played by Susan Luckey.  In the original Broadway cast, Zaneeta was played by Dusty Worrall.

questions.text: What is the kind of dance done by Flamenco dancers where they rhythmically stomp and tap with their heels?
questions.explanation:
Zapateado.

	Zweifacher is a kind of German dance. Zambra is the dance of the Gitano women in Spain. Zanduga is a Mexican dance and song style done like a Waltz.
